name: Ghee Roast Dosa
history: Ghee Roast Dosa is a variation of the traditional South Indian dosa. It is particularly popular in Karnataka and is known for its rich flavor, thanks to the ghee (clarified butter) used in its preparation, making it a favorite among dosa enthusiasts.
description: Ghee Roast Dosa is a thin, crispy, and flavorful crepe made from a fermented batter of rice and lentils, roasted in ghee. It's known for its golden brown texture and rich aroma, often served with chutney or sambar.

instructions.title: Prepare the Batter
instructions.description: Ensure that the dosa batter is at room temperature and well fermented.

instructions.title: Heat the Griddle
instructions.description: Heat a griddle or non-stick pan on medium heat. Sprinkle a few drops of water to check if it's hot enough (the water should sizzle).

instructions.title: Pour and Spread the Batter
instructions.description: Pour a ladleful of batter in the center of the griddle. Quickly spread it in a circular motion to make a thin crepe.

instructions.title: Add Ghee
instructions.description: Drizzle ghee around the edges of the dosa and a little on top. Cook until the dosa turns golden brown and crispy.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Fold the dosa and remove it from the griddle. Serve hot with chutney or sambar.

tips: The griddle should be hot enough to make a thin and crispy dosa.
Use a non-stick pan if you are not experienced with making dosas on an iron griddle.
variations: Add finely chopped onions or masala for a different flavor.
Experiment with different types of chutneys or sambar as accompaniments.

storage.shelfLife: Best consumed immediately. Dosa batter can be stored in the refrigerator for up to 2 days.
storage.instructions: Store unused batter in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat on a griddle or pan until crispy.
presentationTips: Serve on a banana leaf for an authentic South Indian experience.
Accompany with a dollop of butter on top for added richness.
